## Featured Projects

### Virginia Zoning Atlas (2025)

![](resources/zoningatlas.png){width="500"}

**Description:** An interactive web map that compiles and analyzes local zoning ordinances in Virginia. Beginning as an independent web application focusing on the three major metropolitan regions of Virginia, the Virginia Zoning Atlas was later incorporated into the larger National Zoning Atlas project.

**Technologies Used:** R, Shiny, QGIS

**Key Contributions**:

-   Founded and led the development of the initial iteration of the Virginia Zoning Atlas

-   Secured over \$5 million in grant funding to complete the full Virginia Zoning Atlas

-   Presented at multiple conferences and events in support of the atlas project

**Links:** [Website](https://housingforwardva.org/applications/virginia-zoning-atlas/)

### Middle Income Housing Programs: A National Scan (2025)

![](resources/middle.png){width="400"}

**Description:** Virginia Housing contracted with HousingForward Virginia to conduct a national scan of state-funded programs and initiatives serving households earning 80% to 120% area median income. This research provided Virginia Housing with valuable insights into state-level initiatives and high-production regions, informing future policy decisions and program implementations.

**Key Contributions:**

-   The first comprehensive national scan of state-level programs addressing middle-income housing needs

-   Identified 58 programs across 34 states, including three programs in Virginia

-   Programs ranged from homebuyer assistance, developer financing, and even public enterprises

**Links:** Report \| Spreadsheet

### Faith-Owned Property Ownership in Virginia (2024)

![](resources/yigby.png){width="500"}

**Description:** The Virginia Center for Interfaith Public Policy commissioned Housing Forward Virginia to conduct a study quantifying the of land owned by faith-based organizations in Virginia. The report sought to support VICPP's advocacy for Senate Bill 233, which aimed to grant religious organizations certain powers to overcome local zoning barriers for affordable housing development on their own land.

**Technologies Used:** R, QGIS

**Key Contributions:**

-   Determined that out of the over 4 million parcels in Virginia, 22,453 were identified as likely owned by a faith-based organization - equating to 74,116 acres

-   Identified a clear need for standardized parcel records and quality assurance among local government data collection

-   Identified zoning as a major barrier to housing development on a majority of faith-owned parcels in Northern Virginia

**Links:** [Report](chrome-extension://efaidhttps://virginiainterfaithcenter.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/Faith-Based-Property-Ownership-Full-Report-UPDATE.pdf) \| Presentation \| APA Presentation

## Other Projects

-   **Connecting Housing and Health in the Potomac Health Foundation Service Area (2021):** Study commissioned by Potomac Health Foundation to explore the interconnection between housing affordability and health outcomes in Prince William County, Stafford County, and Fairfax County. [Report \[PDF\]](https://housingforwardva.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/PHF-Housing-Health-Report-FINAL-DRAFT.pdf)
-   **State of the Market and Local Policy: Accessory Dwelling Units in the Commonwealth of Virginia (2021):** Findings of a data and information gathering exercise to provide the Accessory Dwelling Unit Stakeholder Advisory Group (SAG) and the Virginia Department of Housing and Community Development (DHCD) input on key issues related to accessory dwelling units (ADUs) in the Commonwealth of Virginia. The work performed in this analysis and the SAG was implemented pursuant to House Bill 2053. [Report \[PDF\]](https://mlsoc.vt.edu/content/dam/mlsoc_vt_edu/research/virginia-center-for-housing-research/publications/ADU%20%20HB2053%20Final.pdf)
-   **George Washington Region Commission: Housing Affordability Study and Action Plan (2020):** Study commissioned by the George Washington Regional Commission to study housing affordability in the Fredericksburg, VA region and provide policy recommendations to address housing challenges. [Report \[PDF\]](https://gwregion.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/GWRC-2020-Housing-Affordability-Study-and-Action-Plan-Final-Layout.pdf)
